intro: Seseli nudum, commonly known as the naked seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are pale green to white in color. Seseli nudum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
